DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare effectiveness spinal cord stimulation ( SCS ) use Medtronic Specify® 5-6-5 multicolumn surgical lead plus optimal medical management ( OMM ) versus OMM alone patient suffer predominant low back pain due fail back surgery syndrome ( FBSS ) .
DOC.brief_title: Spinal Cord Stimulation Predominant Low Back Pain
DOC.detailed_description: The study multi-center , prospective , randomize ( 1:1 ) , open-label , parallel-group design two alternative treatment : - SCS group ( SCS+OMM ) - OMM group
DOC.criteria: SCS candidate Specify 565 surgical lead Has FBSS require surgery ( define persistent recurrent low back leg pain least 6 month duration follow least one decompression and/or fusion procedure ) Average low back pain ≥ 5 assessed baseline NPRS Average low back pain great leg pain Subject persistent moderate severe low back leg pain despite treatment Treated SCS , subcutaneous peripheral nerve stimulation , intrathecal drug delivery system , require back surgery location relate his/her original back pain complaint experimental therapy Most recent back surgery < 6 month ago Low back pain ( leg pain ) Investigator suspect substance abuse might confound study result Radiographic evidence instability require fusion Pain relieve completely lie Life expectancy < 24 month Subject pregnant planning become pregnant course study Subject unable undergo study assessment complete questionnaire independently
